intro: Ageratina potosina, commonly known as the Potosi blueweed, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features small, blue to purple flowers arranged in dense clusters, giving it a striking appearance. It typically grows in rocky or dry habitats, showcasing its adaptability to arid conditions. Ageratina potosina is often found in open woodlands and along stream banks, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
